channel.title: Npcs wont attack back 1 online
channel.description:
When one player is on my server npcs attack back..however when there is more then one player logged in they don't attack back. Any ideas on how to fix this?
Thanks

item.title: Npcs wont attack back 1 online
item.dc:creator: @gon3d34d123 gon3d34d123
item.description:
@gon3d34d123 wrote:

All-star?

If so use Google,

or the easy and quick way, make them agressive if you stand 1 spot* away from them and then to stop attack if you move away more then 2 spots*

  • (Step/steps)
    (changed in NpcHandler.class

Example of code:

for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) { client person = (client) p; 
                    if (p != null && person != null) {
                        if (p != null && person != null) { 
                            if (person.distanceToPoint(npcs[i].absX,
                                    npcs[i].absY)
                                    <= 1
                                            && p.heightLevel
                                                    == npcs[i].heightLevel) {
                                if (npcs[i].npcType == 50
                                        || npcs[i].npcType == 430) { //kbd & shade
                                    npcs[i].StartKilling = person.playerId;
                                    npcs[i].RandomWalk = false;
                                    npcs[i].IsUnderAttack = true;
                                } else if (person.distanceToPoint(
                                        npcs[i].absX, npcs[i].absY)
                                                >= 2
                                                        || person.heightLevel
                                                                != npcs[i].heightLevel) {
                                    if (npcs[i].npcType == 50
                                            || npcs[i].npcType == 430) {
                                        npcs[i].RandomWalk = true;
                                    }
                                }
                            } 
                        }
                    }
                }</blockquote>

Read full topic
